question: Fatty acid found exclusively in breast milk is:-
exp: - Fatty acid found exclusively in breast milk: DHA (Docosa hexanoic acid) - It aids in development of brain by promoting myelination of neurons. OTHER ESSENTIAL FATTY ACIDS & THEIR RICH SOURCES: Linoleic acid, Arachidonic acid - Safflower oil Linolenic acid - flaxseed oil, soyabean oil Eichosa pentanoic acid - fish oils.

question: The highest percentage of polyunsaturated fatty acids is present in:
exp: Fatty acid content of different fats (%): Fats SFA* MUFA* PUFA* Coconut oil 92 6 2 Safflower oil 9 13 75 - highest amount Sunflower seed oil 12 22 62 Soya bean oil 14 24 53 Groundnut oil 19 41 32 Palm oil 39 46 11 Butter 68 29 2 (*SFA: Saturated Fatty Acids; MUFA: Mono-unsaturated Fatty Acids; PUFA: Poly-unsaturated Fatty Acids) - Hence, among given options, high amount of PUFA is found in soyabean oil.

question: How much amount of energy is yielded by one gm of alcohol in the body?
exp: Alcohol supplies about 7cal/gm of energy. Energy yield of macro-nutrients (Proximate principles): Nutrient Energy yield Carbohydrates 4 cal per gram (17 KJ) Proteins 4 cal per gram (17 KJ) Fats 9 cal per gram (37 KJ)

question: Fish is the source of all except:
exp: FISH IS: Richest source of Vitamin A and D is fish liver oils (especially Halibut fish). Rich source of proteins (15-25 percent). Rich source of Calcium, phosphorus, fluorides Good source of iron Poor source of carbohydrates & iodine (barring few sea fish).

question: True statement about Parboiling is?
exp: Parboiling It is paial cooking of rice in steam, for preserving its nutritive quality. This technique is recommended by Central Food Technological Research Institute, Mysore; & is k/a Hot soaking process. Paddy is soaked in water at 65-70oC for 3-4 hrs, resulting grains to swell Then water is drained & steam the soaked paddy in same container for 5-10 mins Resulting paddy is dried & home pounded / milled Uses During steaming - Vitamins & minerals present in outer aleurone layer of rice are driven into inner endosperm. Thus, preserved. During drying - Heat used hardens rice grain. Thus, insect invasion is very difficult & is suitable for storage than raw rice Starch also gets gelatinized improving keeping quality of rice. Disadvantages Development of peculiar smell or "off flavour" which some consumers do not relish. Modern methods of parboiling rice have been developed to outcome this disadvantage.
opa: It is done to preserve nutritive quality of rice.
opb: Recommended by the Central Food Technological Research Institute (CFTRI) & is known as cold soaking process.
opc: Advantage of parboiling is development of sweet smell.
opd: Parboiling can't protect against invasion of insects. Hence, can't be used for storage purposes

question: Protein quantity is assessed by?
exp: PROTEIN QUANTITY The protein content of many Indian foods has been determined and published in food composition tables. One way of evaluating foods as source of protein is to determine what per cent of their energy value is supplied by their protein content. This is known as Protein-Energy Ratio(PE ratio or percentage). Energy from protein PE per cent = ------------------------X 100 Total energy in diet This concept is useful because in many population groups adequate diet is not consumed to meet energy needs, resulting in energy deficits.

question: Poor man's Iron source is:-
exp: Jaggery - Poor man's Iron source Other Good sources of iron include:- Dried pumpkin seeds (Richest)- Liver- Meat, fish and tofu.- Iron-foified breakfast cereals or breas. - Eggs.- Pulses and beans- Nuts and seeds.- Dried fruit - such as dried apricots, prunes and raisins. - Whole grains - such as brown rice.

question: Human milk contain more................ as compared to animal milk?
exp: Milk is the best and most complete of all foods. It is a fine blend of all the nutrients necessary for growth and development of the young ones. Thus milk is a good source of proteins, fats, sugars, vitamins and minerals. Nutritive value of milks compared (value per 100 grams) Buffalo Cow Human Fat (g) 6. 5 4. 1 3. 4 Protein (g) 4. 3 3. 2 1. 1 Lactose (g) 5. 1 4. 4 7. 4 Calcium (mg) 210 120 28 Iron (mg) 0. 2 0. 2 Vitamin C (g) 1 2 3 Minerals (g) 0. 8 0. 8 0. 1 Water (g) 81. 0 87 88 Energy (kcal) 117 67 65

question: Limiting (deficient) amino acid in Maize is?
exp: LIMITING AMINO ACID is AA deficient in a food item Maize - Tryptophan & Lysine Wheat - Threonine & Lysine Pulse - Methionine & Cysteine Supplementary action of proteins: Two different food items must be eaten together.

question: Goal of Prudent diet, Total Cholesterol: HDL ratio should be less than:-
exp: PRUDENT DIET: Dietary modification is the principal preventive strategy in the prevention of CORONARY HEART DISEASE WHO recommendation changes main goal cholesterol: HDL ratio <3. 5 It includes: 1. Reduction of fat intake to <20-30 % of total energy intake 2. Consumption of saturated fats < 7 % of total energy intake 3. Reduction in dietary cholesterol to < 200 mg/day 4. Increase in complex carbohydrate consumption 5. Reduction of salt intake to < 5gms. per day 6. Avoidance of alcohol consumption

question: NPU of egg is
exp: NPU - Net Protein Utilization One of the best indicator of protein quality for recommending the dietary protein requirement NPU of egg is 96 (Highest); therefore Egg is the 'Reference protein' NPU of meat is 80 NPU of milk is 75 Rice -65 Soya -55

question: Limiting amino acids in wheat are:
exp: Amino acids most deficient in proteins of a food item are 'Limiting amino acids'. Food Item Limiting Amino Acid(s) Cereals Threonine (& Lysine) Pulses Methionine (& Cysteine) Maize Tryptophan (& Lysine) - As wheat is a cereal, limiting AA are Lysine & threonine.

question: Soya bean contains protein to the tune of:
exp: Remember Protein content of foods: Food item Protein content (gm % per 100 gms) Soyabean 43. 2 - highest quantity of proteins Pulses 21-28 Fish 15-23 Meat 18-26 Egg (hen) 13 Cereals 6-13 Milk (cow) 3. 2-4. 3 Extra edge: - Highest Quality of protein is seen in EGG, hence, it is used as REFERENCE PROTEIN.

question: Richest source of Linoleic acid:-
exp: - Highest amount of most essential fatty acid is in Safflower oil. Dietary sources of EFA:- Essential fatty acids Dietary source Per cent content Linoleic acid Safflower oil Corn oil Sunflower oil Soyabean oil Sesame oil Groundnut oil Mustard oil Palm oil Coconut oil 73 57 56 51 40 39 15 9 2 Arachidonic acid Meat, eggs Milk (fat) safflower oil 0. 5-0. 3 0. 4-0. 6 Linolenic acid Soyabean oil Flax seed oil 7 Varied Eichosapentaenoic acid Fish oil 10

question: All are true about Net protein utilization (NPU) except:
exp: NPU Nitrogen retained by the body/ Nitrogen intake x100 NPU = / 100 It gives a more complete expression of Protein quality. Egg has the highest NPU value of 96 (100). 1 gram of Nitrogen is equivalent to: 6. 25 grams of protein. NPU of Indian diet: 50-80.
opa: Defined as Nitrogen retained / Nitrogen consumed X 100
opc: Egg has the highest NPU value
opd: 1 gram protein is equivalent to 1 gram Nitrogen

question: Conditionally Essential amino acids are:
exp: Conditionally Essential Amino Acids (CEAA): Non-essential amino acids may turn essential if their precursors are limited in the body. - Among given options Tyrosine (derived from Phenylalanine) and Cysteine (derived from methionine) are CEAA. - Other CEAA include Arginine Glutamine Taurine & Glycine.

question: Not true about content composition of an Egg is:-
exp: Egg composition: - 6g - Fat - 6g - Protein - 30 mg - Calcium - 1. 5 mg - Iron - 70 Kcal - Energy - 250 mg - Cholesterol Also remember, egg is Richest sources of cholesterol. Height NPU (Net protein utilization) - 96, hence known as reference protein. Poor In carbohydrates & vit c.

question: Best indicator of protein quality:-
exp: Best indicator of protein quality: DIAAS (Digestible indispensable amino acid scores) > PDCAAS (Protein digestibility-corrected amino acid score) >NPU (Net protein utilization). DIAAS =100 x. NPU = 100 x (Nitrogen retained by the body) / (Nitrogen intake) Other indicators: Amino acid score, Biological value, Protein efficiency ratio. Amino acid score = 100x (mg of amino acid per gm of test protein)/(mg of same amino acid per gm of reference protein) Also remember, protein quantity is measured by protein energy ratio = 100 x energy from protein / total energy in diet.

question: Highest fat content is present in:
exp: Fat content of food items: Food item Fat content Jowar 4% Bajra 6. 5% - Highest fat content Rice 3% Wheat 3%
